issue.title: CLICKHOUSE-2375 Add interserver DNS retries

labels.name: pr-improvement
labels.description: Pull request with some product improvements

issue.body:
### Changelog category (leave one):
- Improvement

### Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
Added retries on interserver DNS errors

This change is useful for clusters that undergo node replacements / topology changes from time to time.

While a node is being replaced/unavailable, its DNS record may disappear from an external DNS resolver. In the meantime other hosts may see the old topology and still try to connect the node using an old DNS name. Without this change it would lead to the client seeing DNS_ERRORs while other replicas of the node being replaced may be healthy.

comment.body:
@tavplubix That deserves a separate issue & this should be merged ahead of time. As originally reported, this bug is still important as it completely breaks HA.

This patch is small enough to reason that either:
a) there is another bug that already exists, and this bugfix reveals that.
b) the test itself is flawed.

Unfortunately since my original PR I have not had time yet to look further other than a quick glance.

issue.title: Store Webauthn Attestation on registration

labels.name: state: triage
labels.description: Each issue gets this state automatically on creating and it means the ZITADEL team should have a loo

issue.body:
**Description**

Zitadel should store the Webauthn Attestation for future audits.
Follow up on: https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/discussions/4429

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Attestation Conveyance Preference should be configurable or be by default "direct". Currently it is "none".
https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/blob/main/internal/webauthn/webauthn.go#L78
This appears to cause Yubikey hardware tokens to produce an empty `aaguid`.

- [ ] Raw Credential Data from registration should be stored.
https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/blob/main/internal/webauthn/webauthn.go#L100
`credentialData` can serialize into JSON and store as-is. This is for future proofing. Currently, the `credential` var contains a very small submit of the data in `credentialData`.

**Future Work**
- Allow this information to be viewed in the console.
- Allow the administrator to whitelist tokens by `aaguid`. The database for all hardware token aaguids is also publicly available, so there could also be a directory?

issue.title: [Bug]: Migration 05 breaks Postgres compatibility

labels.name: state: in progress
labels.description: Someone is working on this issue right now.

issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the documentation, the existing issues or discussions
- [X] I have joined the [ZITADEL chat](https://zitadel.com/chat)

### Environment

Self-hosted

### Describe the bug

Error Message:
 
```
time="2022-11-23T01:34:21Z" level=fatal msg="unable to migrate step 5" caller="/home/runner/work/zitadel/zitadel/cmd/setup/setup.go:112" error="ERROR: relation \"instance_id_idx\" already exists
```

Relevant migration:
https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/blob/main/cmd/setup/05.go

### To reproduce

Start v2.13.0 using Postgres.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Version

v2.13.0

### Operating System

_No response_

### Relevant Configuration

_No response_

### Additional Context

My assumption is that CockroachDB allows duplicate index names, but Postgres does not.
See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26997441/why-cant-two-tables-have-an-index-of-the-same-name

SQL Example:

```
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.current_sequences (instance_id);
CREATE INDEX
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
ERROR:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists
```

There is also lot of `CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS` in the code. However, this can just silently ignore the issue and not actually make the index! See this example:

```
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.current_sequences (instance_id);
CREATE INDEX
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
ERROR:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
NOTICE:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists, skipping
CREATE INDEX
```

comment.body:

issue.title: MagicDNS without DNS nameservers
issue.body:
**Feature request**

The [MagicDNS documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1081/magicdns) over at Tailscale says this:

> MagicDNS does not requires a [DNS nameserver](https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns/#using-dns-settings-in-the-admin-console) if running Tailscale v1.20 or later. Otherwise, your network must have at least one DNS nameserver set in the [admin console][admin]. These nameservers will receive all DNS queries not handled by MagicDNS.

I wonder if this can be applied to Headscale too, since some computers are behind DNS sinkholes (Pi-Hole) and providing a nameserver defies the purpose of setting up those sinkholes for normal browsing.

comment.body: Relevant #822

issue.title: Resubmit "Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas"

labels.name: pr-bugfix
labels.description: Pull request with bugfix, not backported by default

issue.body:
Reverts ClickHouse/ClickHouse#41252 that reverted ClickHouse/ClickHouse#40881 Bugfix
Resubmitted at request of [tavplubix](https://github.com/tavplubix)

This bug breaks Distributed HA in the case of DNS errors. I believe the revert was a mistake & we should make sure this is in 22.9.

Causes a test `host_is_drop_from_cache_after_consecutive_failures ` https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/issues/41250 to be flaky.
- Logs: https://s3.amazonaws.com/clickhouse-test-reports/0/8587fa59f7c1a8d046395d40e01a404b2bffeac1/integration_tests__tsan__[3/4]/integration_run_test_dns_cache_test_py_0.log
- I believe this does not affect actual functionality and is just a testing error.

_Original description:_

DNS_ERROR would cause the replica to not be marked as unusable, resulting in the replica being repeatedly reattempted on subsequent queries and for connection failover to not function.
(This is common in Kubernetes setups where a replica has failed and it's DNS record is returning NXDOMAIN)

On SELECT of a Distributed table, would additionally result in an intermittent query error if the failed replica is chosen:
`Code: 198. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Not found address of host: chi-clickhouse-main-2-0: While executing Remote. (DNS_ERROR)`

A technical comment, you are free to remove or leave it as it is when PR is created
The following categories are used in the next scripts, update them accordingly
utils/changelog/changelog.py
tests/ci/run_check.py
-->
### Changelog category (leave one):
- Bug Fix (user-visible misbehavior in official stable or prestable release)


### Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas.

comment.body:
@tavplubix Any news on this? The bug this patch fixes still exists in `HEAD`.

For context: Due to this bug, if we restart any Clickhouse Server in our Kube Cluster, the DNS record disappears, and every Distributed table in our cluster starts throwing query errors `DNS_ERROR` (even with an alive replica)

pull_request.title: fix duplicate URL Encode on RelayState
pull_request.body:
The RelayState is URL Encoded twice when using `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST`. 
- This is because Form Data is by default already URL Encoded.
- Additionally, for `HTTP-Redirect`, the RelayState is already Query Escaped: https://github.com/zitadel/saml/blob/main/pkg/provider/redirect.go#L120

This bug results in the ACS receiving the incorrect RelayState. This PR fixes the issue.

issue.title: Support Split DNS
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Split DNS is unsupported currently by Headscale. However, it can easily be supported!

It looks like `dnsConfig.Resolvers` decides whether or not the client overrides its Local DNS resolvers. If you comment out this line, Split DNS works perfectly:
https://github.com/juanfont/headscale/blob/main/config.go#L400

Would like feedback on how you would prefer this is implemented:
- `dns_config.override_dns (default: true)` configuration flag (sets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.split_dns (default: false)` configuration flag (unsets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.resolvers (default: alias to dns_config.nameservers)` configuration flag. 
  - Users can apply `dns_config.resolvers: []` to enable Split DNS.

Can submit a PR if you'd like based on feedback :) Thanks!

comment.body: @madjam002 Yes, but the operator should still have the option to not override at all if Split DNS is incompatible. That would be my preference.

issue.title: Flat Role Claim(s)
issue.body:
## Description

While taking with @rollicks-c around how to use ZITADEL's role model with the oauth2-proxy project the question came up if it is feasible to reuse the existing groups claim. Currently we provide the claim as json which breaks the groups claim parsing because it awaits as list of strings.

A possible solution to this that I already did discuss with @livio-a is to allow customers to request the claim in a flattened manor. For example `["{orgId}:{role}", "{orgId}:{role}"]`

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Discus if a "single project" scope/claim also would make sense (e.g only requesting the users roles for a defined org, either the clients or the users)
- [ ] Design & Implement Scope
- [ ] Design & Implement Claim
- [ ] Update docs
- [ ] Update oauth2-proxy QuickStart

My 2 cents is that we should do this in order to encourage more people to convert from keycloak. Is see more cases there as well. For example ArgoCD also could accept it in that way.

comment.body: Is there a work-around for this issue when using OAuth2 Proxy? From what I see there is no current work-around.

- Allow the administrator to whitelist tokens by `aaguid`. The database for all hardware token aaguids is also publicly available, so there could also be a directory?

issue.title: [Bug]: Migration 05 breaks Postgres compatibility

labels.name: state: in progress
labels.description: Someone is working on this issue right now.

issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the documentation, the existing issues or discussions
- [X] I have joined the [ZITADEL chat](https://zitadel.com/chat)

### Environment

Self-hosted

### Describe the bug

Error Message:
 
```
time="2022-11-23T01:34:21Z" level=fatal msg="unable to migrate step 5" caller="/home/runner/work/zitadel/zitadel/cmd/setup/setup.go:112" error="ERROR: relation \"instance_id_idx\" already exists
```

Relevant migration:
https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/blob/main/cmd/setup/05.go

### To reproduce

Start v2.13.0 using Postgres.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Version

v2.13.0

### Operating System

_No response_

### Relevant Configuration

_No response_

### Additional Context

My assumption is that CockroachDB allows duplicate index names, but Postgres does not.
See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26997441/why-cant-two-tables-have-an-index-of-the-same-name

SQL Example:

```
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.current_sequences (instance_id);
CREATE INDEX
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
ERROR:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists
```

There is also lot of `CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS` in the code. However, this can just silently ignore the issue and not actually make the index! See this example:

```
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.current_sequences (instance_id);
CREATE INDEX
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
ERROR:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
NOTICE:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists, skipping
CREATE INDEX
```

issue.title: MagicDNS without DNS nameservers
issue.body:
**Feature request**

The [MagicDNS documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1081/magicdns) over at Tailscale says this:

> MagicDNS does not requires a [DNS nameserver](https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns/#using-dns-settings-in-the-admin-console) if running Tailscale v1.20 or later. Otherwise, your network must have at least one DNS nameserver set in the [admin console][admin]. These nameservers will receive all DNS queries not handled by MagicDNS.

I wonder if this can be applied to Headscale too, since some computers are behind DNS sinkholes (Pi-Hole) and providing a nameserver defies the purpose of setting up those sinkholes for normal browsing.

issue.title: Resubmit "Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas"

labels.name: pr-bugfix
labels.description: Pull request with bugfix, not backported by default

issue.body:
Reverts ClickHouse/ClickHouse#41252 that reverted ClickHouse/ClickHouse#40881 Bugfix
Resubmitted at request of [tavplubix](https://github.com/tavplubix)

This bug breaks Distributed HA in the case of DNS errors. I believe the revert was a mistake & we should make sure this is in 22.9.

Causes a test `host_is_drop_from_cache_after_consecutive_failures ` https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/issues/41250 to be flaky.
- Logs: https://s3.amazonaws.com/clickhouse-test-reports/0/8587fa59f7c1a8d046395d40e01a404b2bffeac1/integration_tests__tsan__[3/4]/integration_run_test_dns_cache_test_py_0.log
- I believe this does not affect actual functionality and is just a testing error.

_Original description:_

DNS_ERROR would cause the replica to not be marked as unusable, resulting in the replica being repeatedly reattempted on subsequent queries and for connection failover to not function.
(This is common in Kubernetes setups where a replica has failed and it's DNS record is returning NXDOMAIN)

On SELECT of a Distributed table, would additionally result in an intermittent query error if the failed replica is chosen:
`Code: 198. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Not found address of host: chi-clickhouse-main-2-0: While executing Remote. (DNS_ERROR)`

pull_request.title: fix duplicate URL Encode on RelayState
pull_request.body:
The RelayState is URL Encoded twice when using `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST`. 
- This is because Form Data is by default already URL Encoded.
- Additionally, for `HTTP-Redirect`, the RelayState is already Query Escaped: https://github.com/zitadel/saml/blob/main/pkg/provider/redirect.go#L120

This bug results in the ACS receiving the incorrect RelayState. This PR fixes the issue.

issue.title: Support Split DNS
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Split DNS is unsupported currently by Headscale. However, it can easily be supported!

It looks like `dnsConfig.Resolvers` decides whether or not the client overrides its Local DNS resolvers. If you comment out this line, Split DNS works perfectly:
https://github.com/juanfont/headscale/blob/main/config.go#L400

Would like feedback on how you would prefer this is implemented:
- `dns_config.override_dns (default: true)` configuration flag (sets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.split_dns (default: false)` configuration flag (unsets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.resolvers (default: alias to dns_config.nameservers)` configuration flag. 
  - Users can apply `dns_config.resolvers: []` to enable Split DNS.

Can submit a PR if you'd like based on feedback :) Thanks!

comment.body: @madjam002 Yes, but the operator should still have the option to not override at all if Split DNS is incompatible. That would be my preference.

issue.title: Flat Role Claim(s)
issue.body:
## Description

While taking with @rollicks-c around how to use ZITADEL's role model with the oauth2-proxy project the question came up if it is feasible to reuse the existing groups claim. Currently we provide the claim as json which breaks the groups claim parsing because it awaits as list of strings.

A possible solution to this that I already did discuss with @livio-a is to allow customers to request the claim in a flattened manor. For example `["{orgId}:{role}", "{orgId}:{role}"]`

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Discus if a "single project" scope/claim also would make sense (e.g only requesting the users roles for a defined org, either the clients or the users)
- [ ] Design & Implement Scope
- [ ] Design & Implement Claim
- [ ] Update docs
- [ ] Update oauth2-proxy QuickStart

My 2 cents is that we should do this in order to encourage more people to convert from keycloak. Is see more cases there as well. For example ArgoCD also could accept it in that way.

comment.body: Is there a work-around for this issue when using OAuth2 Proxy? From what I see there is no current work-around.

issue.title: CLICKHOUSE-2375 Add interserver DNS retries

labels.name: pr-improvement
labels.description: Pull request with some product improvements

issue.body:
### Changelog category (leave one):
- Improvement

### Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
Added retries on interserver DNS errors

This change is useful for clusters that undergo node replacements / topology changes from time to time.

While a node is being replaced/unavailable, its DNS record may disappear from an external DNS resolver. In the meantime other hosts may see the old topology and still try to connect the node using an old DNS name. Without this change it would lead to the client seeing DNS_ERRORs while other replicas of the node being replaced may be healthy.

comment.body:
@tavplubix That deserves a separate issue & this should be merged ahead of time. As originally reported, this bug is still important as it completely breaks HA.

This patch is small enough to reason that either:
a) there is another bug that already exists, and this bugfix reveals that.
b) the test itself is flawed.

Unfortunately since my original PR I have not had time yet to look further other than a quick glance.

issue.title: Store Webauthn Attestation on registration

labels.name: state: triage
labels.description: Each issue gets this state automatically on creating and it means the ZITADEL team should have a loo

issue.body:
**Description**

Zitadel should store the Webauthn Attestation for future audits.
Follow up on: https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/discussions/4429

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Attestation Conveyance Preference should be configurable or be by default "direct". Currently it is "none".
https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/blob/main/internal/webauthn/webauthn.go#L78
This appears to cause Yubikey hardware tokens to produce an empty `aaguid`.

- [ ] Raw Credential Data from registration should be stored.
https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/blob/main/internal/webauthn/webauthn.go#L100
`credentialData` can serialize into JSON and store as-is. This is for future proofing. Currently, the `credential` var contains a very small submit of the data in `credentialData`.

**Future Work**
- Allow this information to be viewed in the console.
- Allow the administrator to whitelist tokens by `aaguid`. The database for all hardware token aaguids is also publicly available, so there could also be a directory?

issue.title: [Bug]: Migration 05 breaks Postgres compatibility

labels.name: state: triage
labels.description: Each issue gets this state automatically on creating and it means the ZITADEL team should have a loo

issue.body:
### Preflight Checklist

- [X] I could not find a solution in the documentation, the existing issues or discussions
- [X] I have joined the [ZITADEL chat](https://zitadel.com/chat)

### Environment

Self-hosted

### Describe the bug

Error Message:
 
```
time="2022-11-23T01:34:21Z" level=fatal msg="unable to migrate step 5" caller="/home/runner/work/zitadel/zitadel/cmd/setup/setup.go:112" error="ERROR: relation \"instance_id_idx\" already exists
```

Relevant migration:
https://github.com/zitadel/zitadel/blob/main/cmd/setup/05.go

### To reproduce

Start v2.13.0 using Postgres.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Version

v2.13.0

### Operating System

_No response_

### Relevant Configuration

_No response_

### Additional Context

My assumption is that CockroachDB allows duplicate index names, but Postgres does not.
See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26997441/why-cant-two-tables-have-an-index-of-the-same-name

SQL Example:

```
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.current_sequences (instance_id);
CREATE INDEX
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
ERROR:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists
```

There is also lot of `CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS` in the code. However, this can just silently ignore the issue and not actually make the index! See this example:

```
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.current_sequences (instance_id);
CREATE INDEX
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
ERROR:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists
zitadel=> CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS instance_id_idx ON adminapi.failed_events (instance_id);
NOTICE:  relation "instance_id_idx" already exists, skipping
CREATE INDEX
```

issue.title: MagicDNS without DNS nameservers
issue.body:
**Feature request**

The [MagicDNS documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1081/magicdns) over at Tailscale says this:

> MagicDNS does not requires a [DNS nameserver](https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns/#using-dns-settings-in-the-admin-console) if running Tailscale v1.20 or later. Otherwise, your network must have at least one DNS nameserver set in the [admin console][admin]. These nameservers will receive all DNS queries not handled by MagicDNS.

I wonder if this can be applied to Headscale too, since some computers are behind DNS sinkholes (Pi-Hole) and providing a nameserver defies the purpose of setting up those sinkholes for normal browsing.

issue.title: Resubmit "Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas"

labels.name: pr-bugfix
labels.description: Pull request with bugfix, not backported by default

issue.body:
Reverts ClickHouse/ClickHouse#41252 that reverted ClickHouse/ClickHouse#40881 Bugfix
Resubmitted at request of [tavplubix](https://github.com/tavplubix)

This bug breaks Distributed HA in the case of DNS errors. I believe the revert was a mistake & we should make sure this is in 22.9.

Causes a test `host_is_drop_from_cache_after_consecutive_failures ` https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/issues/41250 to be flaky.
- Logs: https://s3.amazonaws.com/clickhouse-test-reports/0/8587fa59f7c1a8d046395d40e01a404b2bffeac1/integration_tests__tsan__[3/4]/integration_run_test_dns_cache_test_py_0.log
- I believe this does not affect actual functionality and is just a testing error.

_Original description:_

DNS_ERROR would cause the replica to not be marked as unusable, resulting in the replica being repeatedly reattempted on subsequent queries and for connection failover to not function.
(This is common in Kubernetes setups where a replica has failed and it's DNS record is returning NXDOMAIN)

On SELECT of a Distributed table, would additionally result in an intermittent query error if the failed replica is chosen:
`Code: 198. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Not found address of host: chi-clickhouse-main-2-0: While executing Remote. (DNS_ERROR)`

For context: Due to this bug, if we restart any Clickhouse Server in our Kube Cluster, the DNS record disappears, and every Distributed table in our cluster starts throwing query errors `DNS_ERROR` (even with an alive replica)

pull_request.title: fix duplicate URL Encode on RelayState
pull_request.body:
The RelayState is URL Encoded twice when using `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST`. 
- This is because Form Data is by default already URL Encoded.
- Additionally, for `HTTP-Redirect`, the RelayState is already Query Escaped: https://github.com/zitadel/saml/blob/main/pkg/provider/redirect.go#L120

This bug results in the ACS receiving the incorrect RelayState. This PR fixes the issue.

issue.title: Support Split DNS
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Split DNS is unsupported currently by Headscale. However, it can easily be supported!

It looks like `dnsConfig.Resolvers` decides whether or not the client overrides its Local DNS resolvers. If you comment out this line, Split DNS works perfectly:
https://github.com/juanfont/headscale/blob/main/config.go#L400

Would like feedback on how you would prefer this is implemented:
- `dns_config.override_dns (default: true)` configuration flag (sets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.split_dns (default: false)` configuration flag (unsets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.resolvers (default: alias to dns_config.nameservers)` configuration flag. 
  - Users can apply `dns_config.resolvers: []` to enable Split DNS.

Can submit a PR if you'd like based on feedback :) Thanks!

comment.body: @madjam002 Yes, but the operator should still have the option to not override at all if Split DNS is incompatible. That would be my preference.

issue.title: Flat Role Claim(s)
issue.body:
## Description

While taking with @rollicks-c around how to use ZITADEL's role model with the oauth2-proxy project the question came up if it is feasible to reuse the existing groups claim. Currently we provide the claim as json which breaks the groups claim parsing because it awaits as list of strings.

A possible solution to this that I already did discuss with @livio-a is to allow customers to request the claim in a flattened manor. For example `["{orgId}:{role}", "{orgId}:{role}"]`

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Discus if a "single project" scope/claim also would make sense (e.g only requesting the users roles for a defined org, either the clients or the users)
- [ ] Design & Implement Scope
- [ ] Design & Implement Claim
- [ ] Update docs
- [ ] Update oauth2-proxy QuickStart

My 2 cents is that we should do this in order to encourage more people to convert from keycloak. Is see more cases there as well. For example ArgoCD also could accept it in that way.

comment.body: Is there a work-around for this issue when using OAuth2 Proxy? From what I see there is no current work-around.
